name: Saharsh Hospital
address: Ring Rd, Mangal Colony, Sethi Nagar, Ujjain, Madhya Pradesh 456010, India

reviews.text:
This is written while am sitting with a patient in the Nursing Home's so Termed Special Room. This room has a TV which doesn't work, a toilet with broken seat, mosquitos, no chair or stool.  One sole.Support staff sleeps in Room No.08 and everytime asked for any help has a standard reply "ABHI BULATA HOON" and then pulls his blanket and sleeps.
The diaper of a patient is not checked or changed even after 12 hours of pleading. Pity the people of.Ujjain who has to pay their hard earned money to such avail such facilities.
Still waiting while writing this review for a nursing staff or Doctor who could attend our patient.
In short a disgusting place if one is.looking for Nursing Care which primarily the objective of any Nursing Home.
Hope the IMA  and respecting authorities take note of such facilities and suspend their licenses for running such facilities until they truly understand the meaning of Nursing.

PS: No trace of any Doctor until now at 09:32 Hours of Jan/29/2020.

Doctor is rude and even staff is careless about patients.
We called the hospital reception to ask if Dr Sapna Mangal is available to consult.
They mentioned that yes you Can come
we we reached in just 10 mins which is minimum we could take

They did the registration and everything then told us that she is in operation.

Was it like so sudden

They dont care if Patient has fever body pain and also if Patient has come by auto by paying money nothing

Then too we went at 1pm again since they asked us to come that time

When we reached One of the staff took vitals but she took temp reading on her own without checking as 98.6.
when i asked her did she take temp reading which doc asked for she askd me do u have fever. I mean how can someone write temp on their own.. after i asked she took reading with thermometer but that too over my tshirt and from underarms

Now doc started shouting we only consider oral reading as true.

Dude its your bad staff what can i do
after that she mentioned the best part

she mentioned that I will admit you because you are worried and under tension

I mean without little compassion how people can open hospital become nurses and doctors

Never to visit hospital. With worst nursing facilities, people who don't even know the meaning of nursing and how critical a situation can be.
In case of electricity cut, it took more thn 10-15 min to restart power back. No one comes even patients keep calling for nursing help.
For critical Covid patient, no one bother to check fever for continuous 5 days and when patient shifted to another hospital fever was 104, while in discharge file they filled every hour temperature for last 5 days as 98.

Worst experience ever.

name: Pushpa Mission Hospital
address: Maria nagar, Dewas Rd, Rishi Nagar, Ujjain, Madhya Pradesh 456010, India

reviews.text:
My mother recently got admitted at Pushpa mission hospital in June 2025 month first in ICU and then in private room. The doctor Dr. Jayvardhan Varma is very good expert doctor. However, I have very bad experience with the most of the nurse staff(Private room) handling my mother case on day to day basis. Most of the nurses are either trainee or they simply dont have been taught how to talk or respond with respect. Following points shows their insensitivity:
1. Whenever asked abt the patients BP value range being taken, they simply try to ignore first. Then being asked again, they still will not tell the range. Does the kin of patient dont have right to ask this basic info.to know the current status of patient health??
2. They come to room and ask the kin of the patient to give the 4-5 different tablets at certain interval during the day..my straight forward question here is if mistakenly by fault the kin gives overdose of some tablet or forget to give one..who should be held responsible for this???
3. Some of the nurse staff give arrogant (rude) answers & looks to any query being asked regarding the patient health in polite manner. If one is properly educated & in nursing profession then how one should respond to a polite question??? It was very frustating many a times for me to bear their rudeness...what if I could also have done the same in response to their rude answers leaving aside my politeness???? But I have kept patience till last...
4. A nurse forgotten to give saline scheduled during the day time..so she literally came at midnight(12 pm)saying she has missed it during the day and now will put on the saline...How one can forget it???? Do patient has no right to sleep in night after so many doses, saline and injection during the day??
5. When Saline are being put..ideally it is duty of nursing staff to come and check if the saline is complete or not( to avoid air or blood from veins getting up)...but all the time..myself have to monitor it and press the bell button which toobwas on extreme corner of room.
6. The response time after pressing the bell was very slow..one has to press the bell button a couple of times for someone to come and attend the case when needed. Most of time, nurses were busy chit-chatting in their main room.
7. The medicine prescribed by doctor or the bill to be paid for any test downatairs during the course of the day should be either given in one go or atleast a couple of times...it happened like I had to go downstairs at the billing or medicine section 4-5 times leaving behind the patient...who will take care of the patient if the kin is being told many times to go downstairs...why not only a couple of times????

Nursing profession is very caring and kind profession in which admitted patient is being treated very kindly. It is absolutely unacceptable if the caring staff displays rude gesture and talk like they are the bosses, even if they are confronting a polite individual. "WHAT IS TRUTH REMAINS  A TRUTH " and the god has seen that there..whatever I have said is what I have experienced, no doubt about it, even my review is not taken seriously. But ignoring it will simply malign the image of the hospital as this will happen again and again to someone in near future. The nursing staff must be given thorough training first and foremost on "How to behave or respond in polite manner".
Few nurses were kind and polite in answering, but some seemed filled with arrogance & lack of mannerism.
Its upto management of Pushpa mission to understand the gravity of situation. Ignore or respond and please take steps to train nurses to speak in polite kind way and not to throw their responsibilities on kin staying with the patient. My mother had been admitted to Room no. 219

Worst hospital I have ever seen. Also the doctor Rekha Chandwani. Here I delivered my baby in 2023 and had a most scary experience of my life. They treat you as if you have done some crime. They mentally herrase you and doesnt provide good care.
Please dont plan going in this hospital.
This hospital and the doctor used to be good in the past. But now nothing is same.

- Nurses require additional training in communication skills for interacting with patients and their families.
- There is a lack of available doctors at night, leading to increased responsibilities for nurses during handovers.
- Staff are unfamiliar with the use of xylocaine for numbing during procedures.
- There is a significant delay (3-4 hours) in informing or interacting with families after delivery.
- Documentation errors, such as incorrect dates, are present.
- Overall, there is a perceived lack of compassion and cooperation among staff.

- Staff is extremely unprofessional. The first thing you expect to be done to a road accident victim is wound clean up and first-aid but the doctor and nurses kept waiting for 4-5 hrs for God knows what. We asked them to do the dressing again and again but they didn't listen. They do things on their own pace no matter what u say.

- ICU ward is no better than a general ward.

- Nurses, ward boys, on-call doctors and even the housekeeping staff thinks of themselves as some sort of royalty, extremely arrogant, slow, unprofessional behavior. Don't even know how to talk to patients or even to each other for that matter.

name: Balaji hospital
address: 50-b, Dewas Rd, near shri ganga, Ramkrishna Colony, Rishi Nagar, Ujjain, Madhya Pradesh 456010, India

reviews.text: Very bad hospital, just a business to make money from patients.

Visited today for checkup of my 4 month old baby to this hospital. I had a incident here today. I parked my vehicle in the parking zone and when I came back I see my vehicle wasn't there. The very first thought was it got stolen. Asked to Watchmen, he had no idea. Asked to hospital staff for the cameras to check . The biggest surprise, this hospital doesn't have security cameras at the entrance. So if anything happens at the entrance, hospital won't be liable bcz there will be no proof. So definitely going here is at own risk. Definitely I won't suggest this hospital and also they won't accept online payments at the reception. We have to go to there pharmacy pay online there nd thn they will give cash to u than that u hve to give to reception. Ridiculous working.

One of the best hospital of the city. Dr. Archna maheshwari is very brilliant and polite as well. She made my c section very smooth.I have also gotten my baby vaccinated by doctor durgesh maheshwari and it was again a painless experience for my kid. Highly recommended.
